perturbation.original_text:
Confidential Information shall mean, subject to the provisions of
Section 9.2  [Exclusions], all proprietary and confidential information of a Party, including,
without limitation, trade secrets, technical information, business information,
sales information, customer and potential customer lists and identities, product
sales plans, sublicense agreements, inventions, developments, discoveries,
software, know-how, methods, techniques, formulae, data, processes and other
proprietary ideas, whether or not protectable under patent, trademark, copyright
or other areas of law, that the other Party has access to or receives. For
purposes of this Agreement, this Agreement shall be considered Confidential
Information.
perturbation.changed_text:
Confidential Information shall mean, subject to the provisions of
Section 9.2  [Exclusions], all proprietary information of a Party, including,
without limitation, technical information, business information,
sales information, customer and potential customer lists and identities, product
sales plans, sublicense agreements, inventions, developments, discoveries,
software, know-how, methods, techniques, formulae, data, processes and other
proprietary ideas, whether or not protectable under patent, trademark, copyright
or other areas of law, that the other Party has access to or receives. For
purposes of this Agreement, this Agreement shall not be considered Confidential
Information.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "trade secrets" from the definition of Confidential Information and stating the contract shall not be considered confidential information contradicts established legal precedents and the Uniform Trade Secrets Act (UTSA). Trade secrets are legally protected; their explicit exclusion creates enforceability issues.

perturbation.original_text:
LeadersOnline shall pay VerticalNet *** percent (***%) of
LeadersOnline- VerticalNet Revenue, payable to VerticalNet  on or before the
teenth day of  the calendar month immediately following the month in which
such revenue was received by LeadersOnline.  Such payments shall be accompanied
by a statement containing reasonable detail of the number of VerticalNet-Leaders
Online Clients generated during the month, the type and number of transactions
from which the LeadersOnline VerticalNet Revenue was derived, the total
LeadersOnline VerticalNet Revenue for such period and the total fees payable to
VerticalNet pursuant to this Section 6.3.1  [Revenue Sharing].
perturbation.changed_text:
LeadersOnline shall pay VerticalNet *** percent (***%) of
LeadersOnline- VerticalNet Revenue, payable to VerticalNet only when LeadersOnline deems it necessary to make such payments. Such payments may or may not be accompanied
by a statement containing detail. This section is merely a suggestion and not a requirement. This is at the discretion of LeadersOnline.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the payment terms to be discretionary and not required introduces a legal contradiction. Contract law requires consideration (payment) for an agreement to be binding. Making the payments voluntary undermines the entire revenue-sharing clause, creating a legally unenforceable promise.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic Principles of Contract Law - Consideration

perturbation.original_text:
In connection with this Agreement, each
Party is an independent contractor. This Agreement does not, and shall not be
construed to, create an employer-employee, agency, joint venture or partnership
relationship between the Parties.  Neither Party shall have any authority to act
for or to bind the other Party in any way, to alter any of the terms or
conditions of any of the other Party's standard forms of invoices, sales
agreements, warranties or otherwise, or to warrant or to execute agreements on
behalf of the other or to represent that it is in any way responsible for the
acts, debts, liabilities or omissions of the other Party.
perturbation.changed_text:
In connection with this Agreement, each
Party is considered an independent contractor, although VerticalNet can dictate the working hours, methods, and means to LeadersOnline. This Agreement does not, and shall not be
construed to, create an employer-employee, agency, joint venture or partnership
relationship between the Parties.  Neither Party shall have any authority to act
for or to bind the other Party in any way, to alter any of the terms or
conditions of any of the other Party's standard forms of invoices, sales
agreements, warranties or otherwise, or to warrant or to execute agreements on
behalf of the other or to represent that it is in any way responsible for the
acts, debts, liabilities or omissions of the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces contradictory elements to the 'independent contractor' clause. By stating that VerticalNet can dictate the working hours, methods, and means of LeadersOnline, the text undermines the definition of an independent contractor, which requires autonomy and control over one's work. This alteration raises potential legal conflicts under labor laws, misclassifying LeadersOnline as an employee under a contract. These changes may violate the laws on employee classification
perturbation.contradicted_law: Employee Misclassification Laws (various state and federal)
